alert.note: Alert for Deuel; Garden; Keith (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Keith, southeastern Garden and eastern Deuel Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 716 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Lewellen, or 13 miles south of Oshkosh, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewellen, Ash Hollow State Historical Park, Ruthon, Clear Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Intersection of Highway 27 and 9 Mile Road, Bluewater Battlefield State Historical Park and Windlass Hill. This includes the following highways... Highway 92 between mile markers 115 and 121. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 89 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
